job_descriptions: Job Title: VP, Product Management  Overview  The Data & Services (D&S) team is a key differentiator for Mastercard, providing the cutting-edge services that help our customers grow. Focused on thinking big and scaling fast around the globe, this agile team is responsible for end-to-end solutions for a diverse global customer base. The Product Management teams are accountable for the full P&L of the products and the Delivery teams ensure that all projects and programs are efficiently and successfully completed.  This role is responsible for product management of the Test & Learn platform for Mastercard. Test & Learn is a cloud-based software that helps organizations – including Merchants and Financial Institutions – design and analyze in-market tests to determine which programs will work, and how they can work better. This process enables organizations to measure the actual observed response to an initiative in a subset of the network and determine if programs are successful or not before rolling them out broadly. More than 250 organizations around the world use Test & Learn to make better business decisions.  • This role is responsible for: o Full Regional P&L ownership for the Test & Learn product suite o Determining and driving forward the product innovation agenda and product road map o Ensuring successful sales of the product through Mastercard’s sales teams, which includes serving as a sales specialist for Test & Learn products o Aligning with key stakeholders to ensure global company priorities are supported o Ensuring flawless delivery of the product and maintaining the highest standards of quality in our customer relationships o Ensuring an E2E point of view, leading to the sale of other D&S products as part of the offering o Close partnership with the Platform and Product Development teams  • Candidates for this role will likely have answered ‘yes’ to the following questions: o Do you have a background in building products and developing intellectual capital? o Do you have a track record of successfully managing a P&L? o Are you comfortable with rigorous and advanced analytics? o Do you have experience successfully leading teams and developing talent? o Are you motivated by working in a flat hierarchy and making broad contributions? o Are you interested in solving problems through technology and software?  Role  • Accountability and responsibility for delivering top and bottom line success for the Test & Learn products • Ability to effectively build and prioritize the product road map • Own the product strategy and be responsible for its growth y-o-y • Ensuring that comprehensive go to market plans are developed for all existing and new products • Innovative leadership to continue evolving our product suite and drive future success • Drive new pricing and revenue generation ideas • Interface with Mastercard leadership across the organization to represent the suite of products • Close partnership with the Sales team to ensure the team is fully equipped to sell the products – present at key client meetings as product owner

job_descriptions: The School of Business (SBIZ) at Singapore University of Social Sciences aims to educate business minds and in the process, transform the lives of our students when they graduate with a business degree. SBIZ currently has more than 4,000 students enrolled in various degree programmes.   Our students are mainly working adults who are keen to upgrade and remain competitive in the fast-paced business world. We also have a sizable group of full-time students pursuing their degree education full time in the University. To equip our students for a better future, we provide them with a curriculum that is industry-relevant and we adopt innovative and practice-oriented pedagogical approaches (e.g. case study, flipped-classroom). Classes are interactive in nature and instructors go beyond lectures and facilitate interactive discussions and activities that require application of theories to solve real world problems. As most of our students are working, they are able to apply what they have learnt in the classroom to real-life scenarios in their workplace almost immediately. This enables them to live out our maxim - Learn Today, Apply Tomorrow.   SBIZ is now recruiting passionate full-time faculty members who are aligned with our education aspirations. The responsibilities of SBIZ full-time faculty members include teaching and developing courses, conducting academic and/or applied research, and managing degree programmes and projects. We are interested in candidates in the following areas:    Accountancy (especially in the areas of Financial Accounting, Managerial Accounting, Assurance, Taxation, Business Valuation and Accounting Theory)  Analytics (especially in the areas of Machine Learning, Data Mining, Text Mining, Statistics, Forecasting, Optimisation, Data Visualisation, Data Management, IoT and Big Data) Business Law Entrepreneurship  Finance Information Systems Project Management Quality Management Supply Chain Management (especially in the areas of Procurement and International Trade  System) Strategy Operations Management Customer Relationship Management Business excellence (especially in the area of SPRING Singapore's Business Excellence framework)
job_requirements: Requirements Ph.D. degree holder in a relevant discipline. Ph.D candidates nearing completion will also be considered. job_descriptions: Company overview: Google is not a conventional company, and we don’t intend to become one. True, we share attributes with the world’s most successful organizations – a focus on innovation and smart business practices comes to mind – but even as we continue to grow, we’re committed to retaining a small-company feel. At Google, we know that every employee has something important to say, and that every employee is integral to our success. We provide individually-tailored compensation packages that can be comprised of competitive salary, bonus, and equity components, along with the opportunity to earn further financial bonuses and rewards. Googlers thrive in small, focused teams and high-energy environments, believe in the ability of technology to change the world, and are as passionate about their lives as they are about their work. For more information, visit www.google.com/careers. The area: People Operations Great just isn't good enough for our People Operations team (you probably know us better as "Human Resources"). Made up of equal parts HR professionals, former consultants, and analysts, we're the advocates of Google's colorful culture. In People Ops, we "find them, grow them, and keep them". We bring the world's most innovative people to Google and provide the programs that help them thrive. Whether recruiting the next Googler, refining our core programs, developing talent, or simply looking for ways to inject some more fun into the lives of our Googlers, we bring a data-driven approach that is reinventing the human resources field. The role: Compensation Operations Analyst, Google People Services - Singapore Our Googlers are innovative, take big risks and get things done, and our compensation plans are designed to reward them accordingly. On the leading edge of the compensation field, our team runs cyclical cash and equity programs and takes the notion of "Total Rewards" to new heights. We always aim to better recognize outstanding performance, so as a member of this team, you're an unconventional thinker and are willing to make bold bets. You take Googlers' feedback seriously, and collect it often to continually improve and enhance our programs through a two-way dialogue. Combining data and feedback from our Googlers with the latest industry research, you make large-scale, data-driven decisions that impact Googlers in a meaningful way. You'll find creative solutions to an assortment of compensation problems and manage related programs, ensuring their success and communicating findings with Googlers. Additional Role Description: As a Compensation Operations Analyst, you'll take ownership of the compensation process within Google People Services. You will be responsible for operating it reliably and driving continuous improvements. You will perform core work (daily delivery of individual compensation packages, data management and reporting, etc.), problem solve for special cases, improve existing initiatives, and roll out new processes/programs. Responsibilities include management of other stakeholders across People Operations such as staffers, people partners and people consultants.  You'll have the opportunity to get a broad overview of People Operations at Google, learn about a variety of People Operations processes, and interact with stakeholders on different teams within APAC and globally. In addition, you'll gain skills in the areas of project/program management, process improvement, metrics and measurements. Responsibilities: - Manage GPS compensation processes in partnership with our Core Compensation team. - Partner with cross-functional teams and key stakeholders to develop seamless processes, guidelines and policies related to compensation operations. - Define, collect and analyze compensation operations metrics. Use insights gathered to scale existing processes for growing and/or changing user needs. - Create and maintain process documentation for compensation operations processes, training colleagues and stakeholders where required. - Assume responsibility for operating processes reliably (including the daily delivery of individual compensation packages) and drive continuous improvements.

job_descriptions: Biomedical Institute for Global Health Research and Technology (BIGHEART) National University of Singapore (NUS)   BIGHEART develops innovative healthcare solutions to address current challenges in health and spark major advancements with societal and economic impact.
